content.description: Starts on the left rail and a good crimp around the right of the boulder. Moves upward along the lip and a series of pretty good left hand holds.  One slightly large move with either hand to a mega jug, and you just have to mantle right to top out.
content.protection: 2 pads should suffice. The landing is pretty good, but if you intend to make a big move for the mega jug, a spotter behind is recommended so you don’t fall down the hill.
content.location: This is in a freestanding boulder about 25 feet down the hill from Crimping Corgi.

climbs.name: Waiting For a Friend to Come

content.description: Starts on the jug rail right of the arete. Moves upward on a crimp to a pretty deep crimp sloper.  Can be thrown to as first move for optional challenge and coolness. After a few jugs, the top out is slightly sketchy, but there are small holds if you look.
content.protection: 2 pads should suffice, or one with a good spotter. Landing is good for area standards, but there are some rocks.
content.location: This is in the middle of a small boulder pile on the trail that leads to the Slide and routes like Get Spidered.  It’s located between a few of the rocks and is on the left wall if you enter directly from the trail.

content.description: Start on blocky jug. Climb the swooping arete.
Start in a bat hang with two hands matching a jug block. Found out how to get your feet back underneath you. Then fight your way through the sloppy arete. Easy mantel top out.
Sit start on left hand Undercling and right hand pinch. Unique movement to an uneasy feeling top out.
Stand start on crimps. Climbs up and left. Same top out as tempo.
content.location: Slide Boulders. Same wall as tempo.
Slide boulders. To the right of Fear of the Dab.

content.description: The problem starts on a wide compression between the lowest arete hold and a small sidepull crimp under the roof. Thought provoking and precise moves lead to jugs then a moderate mantle. Cool movement but incredibly dabbyThere is also any obvious low start on two opposing sidepulls which will add a nails hard double-digit single move into the regular startNote: problem was FA'd in 90 degree weather so grade may be inflated somewhat
content.protection: Pads. Fall could be bad with nearby rocks and a wall behind you
content.location: At the slide, behind Driftwood v3 and an unnamed nick chavis v4 in a small cave opening

content.description: Sit start with left Undercling and right pinch. Fire for a weird hold at the lip. Walk the feet out right. Then make a desperate bump for a good crimp.
content.location: Slide Boulders. To the left of Master Powers.

content.description: Squat start on crimp rail bottom right of boulder. Climb straight up then traverse left. Top out on Apex of boulder.

Sit start with left hand on the diagonal crimp rail and right hand on a lower nearby crimp. Get a left toe hook around the arete. Then move right hand to a side pull crimp. Next make a huge move to a jug sidepull. Keep the tension don’t cut feet. Then make a dynamic left hand to the top of the lip. Mild top out.

Sit start on the diagonal crimp rail. Move left hand to the arete. Then move right hand to a crimp in the middle of the face. Keep bumping left hand using the arete. Then a dynamic right hand to the top of the boulder. Mild top out.
First boulders you hit on the upper trail - just before the slide
